article.headline: Coastal Carolina 76, VMI 63
article.story: CONWAY, S.C. (AP) -- Pele Paelay and Jack Leisure each scored 19 points as Coastal Carolina beat VMI 76-63 on Monday night. The Chanticleers (16-9, 10-4 Big South Conference) have won eight in a row and 10 of their last 11 to secure third place in the Big South. Coastal Carolina could move into a tie for first by the end of the regular season Saturday with some help. The Keydets (7-19, 2-13 Big South) led 58-57 on Brother Chavis' 3-pointer with just under nine minutes to go. But the Chanticleers took back the lead on a layup by Paelay and ended the game on a 19-5 run. Coastal Carolina had 11 steals and forced 16 VMI turnovers. Matt Murrer and Travis Holmes each scored 13 points for the Keydets, who must beat Radford on Thursday to have a chance to make the Big South tournament. Moses Sonko scored 14 points and Joseph Harris had nine rebounds for Coastal Carolina, who outscored VMI 36-20 in the paint.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
